## Discussion

When evaluated, `receiversRef` indicates the receiver or receivers of the `move` AppleScript command.

This method overrides [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSScriptCommand/receiversSpecifier] in [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSScriptCommand]. It performs the same function as the overridden method, with a critical difference: it causes the container specifier part of the passed-in object specifier to become the receiver specifier of the command, and the key part of the passed-in object specifier to become the key specifier. If, for example, `receiversRef` is a specifier for `the third paragraph of the first document`, the receiver specifier is `the first document` while the key specifier is `the third paragraph`.

# setReceiversSpecifier(_:)

**Instance Method**

Sets the receiver’s object specifier.

## Declaration

```swift
func setReceiversSpecifier(_ receiversRef: NSScriptObjectSpecifier?)
```

## Parameters

- **receiversRef**: The receiver’s object specifier.

## Discussion

When evaluated, `receiversRef` indicates the receiver or receivers of the `move` AppleScript command.

This method overrides [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSScriptCommand/receiversSpecifier] in [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSScriptCommand]. It performs the same function as the overridden method, with a critical difference: it causes the container specifier part of the passed-in object specifier to become the receiver specifier of the command, and the key part of the passed-in object specifier to become the key specifier. If, for example, `receiversRef` is a specifier for `the third paragraph of the first document`, the receiver specifier is `the first document` while the key specifier is `the third paragraph`.

## Working with specifiers

- **keySpecifier**: Returns a specifier for the object or objects to be moved.

items.description: Returns a specifier for the object or objects to be moved.
